<title level="1" pfs="">[Darivan](/NPCs.aspx?ID=2190)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Darivan is not the classic image of a [Lamashtan](/Deities.aspx?ID=11) cultist. While deeply religious, his magical power stems not from his faith, but from a link to his ancestral past. The favor of a [dryad](/Monsters.aspx?ID=312) helped his grandfather escape from a brutal life and find a safe new homeland for his people, but Darivan never held patience for that. To Darivan, his sorcerous legacy and his sinister faith are two wholly separate elements, but his recent visions of the bloom of Lamashtu bringing a new swath of monsters to the Stolen Lands has compelled him strongly, showing him how his fey ancestry and his demonic faith can be made stronger.

 In combat, Darivan relies on his spells against ranged foes and his falchion and claw in melee. He activates Bloom Regeneration if an attack reduces him to 100 Hit Points or fewer, then shifts tactics to casting [_air walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=6) and retreating upward to use spells against foes.

([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 37

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32
</column>

</column>

**Bloom Regeneration** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) **Trigger** Darivan takes damage while he's within the Cradle of Lamashtu. **Effect** Darivan cries out a quick prayer to the Mother of Monsters, and filaments of fungus slither up into his wounded body, healing 4d6 points of damage. For the next 4 rounds, Darivan gains [regeneration](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=26) 10; this regeneration can be deactivated by cold iron or good damage. Darivan can't activate Bloom Regeneration again for 24 hours.

**Damage** 2d6+8 slashing

- **2nd**
[Barkskin](/Spells.aspx?ID=20), [Calm Emotions](/Spells.aspx?ID=31), [Create Food](/Spells.aspx?ID=52), [Entangle](/Spells.aspx?ID=103), [Glitterdust](/Spells.aspx?ID=136) (4 slots)
- **3rd**
[Animal Vision](/Spells.aspx?ID=12), [Blindness](/Spells.aspx?ID=26), [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78), [Shocking Grasp](/Spells.aspx?ID=283), [Slow](/Spells.aspx?ID=289) (4 slots)
- **4th**
[Air Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=6), [Shape Stone](/Spells.aspx?ID=276), [Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294), [Vital Beacon](/Spells.aspx?ID=359), [Weapon Storm](/Spells.aspx?ID=373) (4 slots)
- **5th**
[Cone of Cold](/Spells.aspx?ID=47), [Crushing Despair](/Spells.aspx?ID=57), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148), [Passwall](/Spells.aspx?ID=216), [Wall of Stone](/Spells.aspx?ID=365) (4 slots)

**Sorcerer Bloodline Spells** DC 29, 1 Focus Point
- **1st**
[Nymph's Token](/Spells.aspx?ID=785)

**Rituals** 

- **1st**
monstrous bloom

**Bloodline Magic**   When Darivan's bloodline magic activates, his movements become supernaturally graceful and distracting, granting him a +1 status bonus to [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) checks for 1 round or imposing a –1 status penalty on one target's Will saves for 1 round.

**Bleed for Lamashtu  **Requirement** Darivan hasn't attempted a falchion strike yet. **Effect** Darivan attempts a Strike with a falchion. On a hit, he inflicts an additional 2d6 [bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) damage.** <actions string="Single Action" />  

</column>
